Package generation

Class Distance

java.lang.Object
generation.Distance
public class Distance extends Object
This class has the responsibility to provide the distance for each cell to the exit of a maze. It represents this information as a matrix, a 2D integer array. Its dimensions and positioning of (x,y) coordinates matches with the same notion in the Cells.java class that represents the walls for the maze. All methods assume that given (x,y) coordinates are with its legal range [0,width-1],[0,height-1] such that no additional parameter checks are performed. This is reasonable as this class is used only internally to the package. The expected lifecycle for an instance of this class is: a) initialization either by providing a distance matrix with valid distance values or by providing a cells object and calling for computeDistances to derive valid distance values, before b) obtaining information on distance values for specific positions as well as information about the exit or starting position for the maze. This code is refactored code from MazeBuilder.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

  • Constructor Details

    • Distance

      public Distance​(int w, int h)
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      w - is the width of the maze in the horizontal direction
      h - is the height of the maze in the vertical direction

    • Distance

      public Distance​(int[][] distances)
      Constructor that directly uses the given reference. Warning: the given parameter is shared, not copied. This breaks encapsulation and can have side effects. This constructor is currently only used in the MazeFileReader to hand a 2D array that is parsed from a file to a Distance object.
      Parameters:
      distances - is a non-null matrix of appropriate width x height dimension

  • Method Details

    • setAllDistanceValues

      public void setAllDistanceValues​(int[][] distances)
      Sets the internal attribute to the given parameter value. Can be used to provide precomputed distance values to an object or to use an existing array and have its values computed by a subsequent call to computeDistances(Floorplan) computeDistances. Warning, the array is not copied but directly shared with the environment that provides it! This can have undesired side effects. Handle with care!
      Parameters:
      distances - is an array with distance values to the exit, can not be null

    • getAllDistanceValues

      public int[][] getAllDistanceValues()
      Gets access to a width x height array of distances. Warning, this exposes the internal attribute and is intended for read access only. Do not modify entries of the returned array.
      Returns:
      array with distance values

    • getDistanceValue

      public int getDistanceValue​(int x, int y)
      Gets the distance value for the given (x,y) position
      Parameters:
      x - is the x coordinate, 0 <= x < width
      y - is the y coordinate, 0 <= y < height
      Returns:
      the distance value for the given (x,y) position

    • computeDistances

      public int[] computeDistances​(Floorplan cells)
      Compute distances for given cells object of a maze. The method determines an exit position for the maze as well as a starting position. It computes a distance value for each position (x,y) that represents the number of steps through intermediate cells to reach the exit with the understanding that one can not cross walls and can only to go an adjacent position if there is no wallboard in between. The exit position is returned for convenience. This method provides the main responsibility of the class, namely to determine the distance to the exit position. Once called, client classes can use getDistanceValue(), getExitPosition(), and getStartPosition().
      Parameters:
      cells - with information on wallboards for a maze, can not be null, read only
      Returns:
      exit position somewhere on the border

    • getStartPosition

      public int[] getStartPosition()
      Gets the starting position. Assumes that computeDistances() was called before.
      Returns:
      starting position somewhere within maze

    • getMaxDistance

      public int getMaxDistance()
      Gets maximum distance present in maze Assumes that computeDistances() was called before
      Returns:
      the maximum distance

    • getMinDistance

      public int getMinDistance()
      Gets minimum distance present in maze Assumes that computeDistances() was called before
      Returns:
      the minimum distance which should be 1 and is located at the exit position

    • getExitPosition

      public int[] getExitPosition()
      Gets the exit position. Assumes that computeDistances() was called before.
      Returns:
      exit position somewhere on the border

    • isExitPosition

      public boolean isExitPosition​(int x, int y)
      Determines if given position is the exit position.
      Parameters:
      x - is the x coordinate, 0 <= x < width
      y - is the y coordinate, 0 <= y < height
      Returns:
      true if (x,y) is the exit position, falls otherwise
